speaker: Hall of Mirrors
lines: Mirrors hang where windows were; they open to rooms with no furniture but you.
Each pane shows a city that is almost Valoria and a you that is almost you.
A crack travels across a reflection and stops at your eye.
A drape moves though no mirror shows wind.
On a pedestal, a mask stares out; behind its eyes something kind and something hungry share a seat.
Footfalls arrive late; echoes compare notes and pick a favorite.
A string tied to your wrist in glass leads to a door that isn't here.
You could put on the mask and learn a shortcut.
You could break a mirror and make an honest window.

choices.text: Break a mirror and climb through.
